section.name: General Settings
section.description: This contains general format settings for UsfmTex macro package.

setting.name: Measurement Unit
setting.description: The unit of measurement used in this publication.

setting.name: Source Encoding Transform
setting.description: In the case of multi-script projects or non-Unicode, an encoding transformation may be needed make the source data useful to the system. The encoding information is stored in the Encoding section and should be the same as other files used in this project. (Default = False)

section.name: Page Layout
section.description: Page layout information. This covers general page layout format options.

setting.name: Printer Page Size ID Code
setting.description: For print output to a common printer a page size ID has to be identified. If no size is specified (null/none) the printer page size will be the same as the document. Two page sizes are supported, A4 and US Letter. Default = A4

setting.name: Page Size ID Code
setting.description: If you are using a common page size please enter the standard code. If a custom size is being used just enter "custom". Default = A5

setting.name: Page Height
setting.description: This is the height of the page after it has been printed and trimmed to its final size. Default = 210mm (A5)

setting.name: Page Width
setting.description: This is the width of the page after it has been printed and trimmed to its final size. Default = 148mm (A5)

setting.name: Top Margin
setting.description: The distance from the top of the page to the printable text area. Default = 15

setting.name: Bottom Margin
setting.description: The distance from the bottom of the page to the printable text area. Default = 10

setting.name: Inside Margin
setting.description: The distance from the inside of the page (gutter) to the printable text area. Default = 10

setting.name: Outside Margin
setting.description: The distance from the outside of the page (left or right) to the printable text area. Default = 10

setting.name: Body Columns (Two)
setting.description: The number of columns used for body text. Default = 2 (True)

setting.name: Introduction Columns (Two)
setting.description: The number of columns used for introduction text. Default = 1 (False)

setting.name: Title Columns (Two)
setting.description: The number of columns used for book title text. Default = 1 (False)

setting.name: Header Position
setting.description: Relative position of the baseline of the header to the top edge of the paper (not the text area) Default = 5mm

setting.name: Footer Position
setting.description: Relative position of the baseline of the footer to the bottom edge of the paper (not the text area) Default = 5mm

section.name: Document Features
section.description: Various features used in this document/publication.

setting.name: Use PDF-X1a Output
setting.description: If this is set to true, XeTeX should output all the necessary header information to make the document comply to the PDF X1a standard for printing. Default = True

setting.name: Use Document Information
setting.description: If this is set to true, document information will be added in header and footer lines. This information will be merged with the typeset page. This is independent to the background merge operation. Default = False

setting.name: Document Information Text
setting.description: Text that can be added to the footer, used along with other document information. This is optional information.

setting.name: Use Diagnostic
setting.description: If this is set to true, diagnostic components (as per the Diagnostic components list) will be superimposed over the page contents to enable checking for various problems with the layout of the page contents. This is done with a similar process as adding page a background but is not the same thing. Default = False

setting.name: Regenerate Transparency
setting.description: If this is set to true, any exsisting transparency (diagnostic) file will be deleted and a new/fresh one will be regenerated. If false, the existing one will be used, or, if it doesn't exist, one will be created. Default = False

setting.name: Diagnostic Components
setting.description: Diagnostic components to be superimposed on the contents of a page used to diagnose format issues. Currently supported components are, leading. Default = leading

setting.name: Use Background
setting.description: If this is set to true, a background (or watermark) will be merged with the typeset page. Multiple backgrounds can be defined in the backgroundComponents field. Default = False

setting.name: Regenerate Background
setting.description: If this is set to true, any exsisting background file will be deleted and a new/fresh one will be regenerated. If false, the existing one will be used, or, if it doesn't exist, one will be created. Default = False

setting.name: Background Components
setting.description: Components to be used for a document. Currently the following are supported: watermark, cropmarks, lines, and pagebox. Default = watermark

setting.name: Watermark Text
setting.description: Text to be used for the watermark background. Default = DRAFT

setting.name: Use Running Header Rule
setting.description: If this is set to true a rule will be placed in the header according to the Running Header Rule Position. Default = False

setting.name: Running Header Rule Position
setting.description: Position of rule under the running head if used. It is measured from the baseline of the header. Default = 4mm

setting.name: Include Footnotes
setting.description: [NOT IMPLEMENTED] Include footnotes in the output. Defalt = True

setting.name: Use Footnote Rule
setting.description: Set to true to be able to use a footnote rule that goes between the body text and footnotes.

setting.name: Column Gutter Rule
setting.description: Do you want to place a vertical line between the columns in the column gutter? Default = False

setting.name: Use Special Callers (Footnotes)
setting.description: If set to true, a symbol or a csv sequence of symbols is needed for footnotes. Default = False

setting.name: Special Callers (Footnotes)
setting.description: Provide a symbol (or a csv sequence of symbols) is desired for a footnote caller character, rather than the default incremental character(s). Default = \kern0.2em *\kern0.4em

setting.name: Use Special Callers (Crossreferences)
setting.description: If set to true, a symbol or a csv sequence of symbols is needed for crossreference. Default = False

setting.name: Special Callers (Crossreferences)
setting.description: Provide a symbol (or a csv sequence of symbols) is desired for a crossreference caller character, rather than the default incremental character(s). Default = \kern0.2em *\kern0.4em

setting.name: Numeric Callers (Footnotes)
setting.description: Use numeric callers on footnote references instead of alphabetic callers. Default = False

setting.name: Page Reset Callers (Footnotes)
setting.description: Restart numbering or character sequence for footnotes on each page. Default = False

setting.name: Omit Caller In Footnotes
setting.description: To omit caller characters from the footnotes at the bottom of the page.

setting.name: Omit Caller In Crossreferences
setting.description: To omit caller characters from the crossreferences at the bottom of the page.

setting.name: Paragraphed Footnotes
setting.description: Output the footnotes on the bottom of the page in paragraph format rather than one line for each one. Default = True

setting.name: Paragraphed Crossreferences
setting.description: Output the crossreferences on the bottom of the page in paragraph format rather than one line for each one. Default = True

setting.name: Use Running Header
setting.description: Set this to true if you want to have a running header line in your document. (Defalt = True)

setting.name: Use Running Footer
setting.description: Set this to true if you want to have a running footer line in your document. (Defalt = False)

setting.name: Figure Placeholders
setting.description: Turn On Figure Placeholders - If set to true, the actual picture graphic will not be output, rather a spaceholder will be output in its place. This makes processing much faster. Default = True

setting.name: Captions
setting.description: Add a caption to the illustration. Set as True if you want captions included with illustrations. Default = True

setting.name: Caption Reference
setting.description: Add illustration reference to caption. Set as true if you want a reference added to the caption. Default = True

setting.name: Use Auto Callers (Crossrefs)
setting.description: Set to true if a symbol or a csv sequence of symbols is needed for crossreferences. Default = True

setting.name: Numeric Callers (Crossrefs)
setting.description: Use numeric callers on cross references instead of alphabetic callers. Default = False

setting.name: Use Hanging Punctuation
setting.description: Turn on hanging punctuation. This is where various punctuation characters which come at the end of a line will be positioned just outside the margin of the text. Default = False

section.name: Text Elements
section.description: General settings for text level elements

setting.name: Justify Paragraphs
setting.description: Paragraphs are justified by default. Set this to false to turn off justification. Default = True

setting.name: Right To Left
setting.description: Uncomment to use right-to-left text layout mode Default = False

setting.name: Body Text Font Size
setting.description: The size, in points, of the body text. Enter only an integer. Default = 10 points

setting.name: Body Text Leading
setting.description: The size, in points, of the body text leading. Enter only an integer. Default = 12 points

setting.name: Font Default Size
setting.description: The default size value in points (pt) of the body text. Do NOT add "pt" to indicate value in points, that is assumed. This is the point size set in the usfm.sty for \p, \m, \q, etc. This is used by macro functions to calulate different settings for this macro package do not change this unless you know what you are doing. Defalt size is 12pt.

setting.name: Body Text Default Leading
setting.description: The default size value in points (pt) of the body text leading. Do NOT add "pt" to indicate value in points, that is assumed. This is the default leading used for line spacing with \p, \m, \q, etc. This is used by macro functions to calulate different settings for this macro package do not change this unless you know what you are doing. Defalt size is 14pt.
